alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Kimble; Mason; Menard; San Saba; Schleicher; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 29 at 9:32PM CST until February 01 at 9:00AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Several rounds of wintry precipitation are likely across West Central Texas. The first round will develop late tonight and continue through Monday morning. This will mainly fall as a light freezing rain across the area. A second round of heavier and more widespread wintry precipitation is expected to develop Monday night and continue into Wednesday morning, as freezing rain and sleet overspread the area. * WHERE...All of West Central Texas * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 AM to Noon CST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Accumulations of ice on roadways may make for hazardous travel conditions. Accumulations are also possible on power lines and trees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Crockett; Kimble; Mason; Menard; San Saba; Schleicher; Sutton
